oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Apostolic Church of God the Lord Jesus homecoming service home movie, 1974
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Vance, Mary
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording begins with a service with serpent handling and dancing. Woman stands outside church with a sign that reads "Apostolic Church of God the Lord Jesus". Congregation has an outside luncheon. Followed by an inside service with serpent handling and dancing. A man burns himself with two torches. A service is held in a member's home. Johnny Holbrook leads service and lays hands on a woman. Larry Elledge handles fire and dances.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region -- Religious life and customs; Dance -- Religious aspects; Homecoming; Imposition of hands; Lay preaching; Snake cults (Holiness churches) -- Appalachian Region
Browing, Junior; Elledge, Larry; Holbrook, Johnny
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Jesus Name tradition services home movies
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Mary Vance Jesus Name Tradition photographs and home movies
